markdownRemark.html:
Big Data Integration and Processing

Summary from Big Data Modeling and Management

  • Database management systems handle low level data management operations, help organization of the data using a data model, and provide an open programmable access to data.

  • Different Data Models:

    • Relational Data: data looks like tables
    • Semi-structured Data: document data, XML, and JSON
    • Graph Data: Social Networks, email networks
    • Text Data: Articles, reports

  • Streaming Data: an infinite flow of data coming from a data source

    • It is generally processed in chunks or windows

  • Big Data Management Systems(BDMS)

    • Designed for parallel and distributed processing
    • Most systems provide eventual consistency
    • Often built on top of Hadoop

Why is Big Data Processing Different?

  • With increasing load, errors start to appear like events cant be inserted into the database at the speed they are coming in
  • One possible solution could be: use a buffer or a queue to process the advancing chunks. You could also process them to be organized in windows at the same time. But overtime you will have to increase this capacity with the growth
  • A compute node or a server may go down and lead to corruption or loss of data

  • General requirements of high scale data:

    • Split volumes of data
    • Access data fast
    • Distribute computation to various nodes
    • Replicate data partitions
    • Recover files when needed
    • Scaling up and scaling out
    • Optimized and extensible for many data types

    • Enable both streaming and batch processing

      • Low Latency processing of streaming data
      • Accurate processing of all available data

Querying Aerospike

  • Data are organized in lean spaces which can be in memory or on flash disks.
  • Name spaces are top level data containers.
  • The way you collect data in name spaces relates to how data is stored and managed.
  • So name space contains records, indexes, and policies.
  • Now policies dictate name space behavior like how data is stored, whether it's on RAM or disk, or how how many replicas exist for a record, and when records expire.

Big Data Processing Pipeline

  • Most big data pipeline are composed of a set of operations executed one after the other as a pipeline

  • Transformations are higher order tools that are helpful in converting data from one form to another

    • Map is one of the most common transformation used to apply to all members of a set
  • Aggregation is any operation on a data set that performs a specific transformation, taking all the related data elements into consideration

  • Some common analytical operations:

    • Classification: the goal is to predict a categorical target from the input data. A categorical target is one with discreet values or categories, instead of continuous values
    • Clustering: the goal is to organize similar items in to groups of association
    • Path Analysis: the goal is to analyze sequences of nodes and edges in a graph
    • Connectivity Analysis: the goal is to find and track groups to determine interactions between entities

Big Data Processing Systems

  • Depending on the resources we have access to and characteristics of our application, we apply several considerations to evaluate and pick a software stack for big data

  • Execution Model:

    • Semantics of streaming, including exactly once or at least one processing for each event, or being able to keep the state of the data, is an important concern for this execution model
    • Latency is another important criteria, depending on the application

  • MapReduce:

    • Execution Model: Batch processing using disk storage
    • Latency: High
    • Fault Tolerance: Replication

  • Spark:

    • Execution Model: Batch and stream processing using disk and memory storage
    • Latency: Low latency for small size

  • Flink:

    • Execution Model: Batch and stream processing using disk and memory storage
    • Latency: Low

  • Beam:

    • Execution Model: Batch and stream processing
    • Latency: Low

  • Apache Storm:

    • Execution Model: Stream processing
    • Latency: Very low

  • Lambda Architecture:

    • It uses Storm for speed layer and Hadoop and HBase for batch and serving layers


Course Completion Certificate: Big Data Integration and Processing
